metadata.title: CVE-2017-14059 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In FFmpeg 3.3.3, a DoS in cine_read_header() due to lack of an EOF checkmight cause huge CPU and memory consumption. When a crafted CINE file,which claims a large "duration" field in the header but does not containsufficient backing data, is provided, the image-offset parsing loop wouldconsume huge CPU and memory resources, since there is no EOF check insidethe loop.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14059` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
